description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft WDAC OLE DB Provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-21360):

1. Identify the relevant version of Windows you are running based on the provided build numbers.
2. Download and apply the appropriate update package from the Microsoft Update Catalog for your version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 use: [KB5034765](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034765)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2 use: [KB5034765](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034765)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2 use: [KB5034766](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034766)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 use: [KB5034763](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034763)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 use: [KB5034763](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034763)
   - For Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems with Version 22H2 and 21H2 use: [KB5034763](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034763)
3. Restart your system after installation to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
- The updates address a critical heap-based buffer overflow that could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.
- For safe execution, ensure all critical data is backed up before applying the patches.
- For more details, refer to the respective KB articles after installation.
